title: Ethereum trades above $2K for the first time in almost a year - CryptoSlate
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum (ETH) surged above $2,000 for the first time in a year after the successful Shappella upgrade. ETH rose 6% in the last 24 hours, outperforming Bitcoin's 1% gain. The upgrade enables validators to withdraw their staked ETH, leading to increased liquidity. Liquid staking tokens like StakeWise (SWISE) and Frax Share (FXS) rallied 3-6%, while other protocols saw smaller gains. The total value of assets locked on top liquid staking protocols rose 4% in the last 24 hours, with over 8 million ETH tokens worth $16.03 billion staked through these platforms.

title: Bitcoin Set to Eclipse Ethereum's 5-year Returns - Blockworks
summary: Bitcoin (BTC) is poised to surpass Ethereum's (ETH) five-year returns, according to a recent analysis by Blockworks. While ETH had previously dominated BTC in terms of returns, the tables have turned in recent months. BTC has gained ground, thanks to a falling ETH-to-BTC ratio, and is now within striking distance of topping ETH over the past five years. The analysis suggests that the narrative has shifted somewhat since the 2021 bull run, with BTC gaining strength due to its reliability and hedging against liquidity injections. However, the macro situation has changed since the 2018 bull market, and the Federal Reserve may need to pivot away from its tightening policy soon to prevent a credit crunch.

title: Ethereum Shanghai upgrade prompts Ether withdrawals, but no stampede for exits - Forkast News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's Shanghai upgrade has triggered Ether withdrawals, but the amount withdrawn so far is in line with expectations. Over 53,000 Ether (worth $102 million) has been withdrawn, with another 558,000 held by 268,000 validators awaiting withdrawal. The price of Ether has risen 2.5% in the past 24 hours, and around 18 million Ether (worth $34.5 billion) is staked in the network. While some analysts had expected a larger rush to exit, the withdrawal amounts so far are seen as manageable. Daily system limits on staked Ether withdrawals may prevent a sell-off in the token.

title: Ether Jumps Above $2K a Day After Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade - CoinDesk
summary: Ether (ETH) price surged above $2K after Ethereum's Shanghai upgrade. ARB token, used in Ethereum scaling system Arbitrum, rallied 15% in 24 hours. Uniswap launched a mobile wallet app supporting Arbitrum. CoinDesk Market Index rose 3% on the day.

title: Vitalik Says Ethereum Will Focus On Scalability Post-Shapella - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Vitalik Buterin said Ethereum will focus on scalability after the Shapella upgrade in early 2024. The next major upgrade will include EIP-4844, which will improve scalability of Layer 2 rollups. Buterin predicted a 10x improvement in scalability with proto-danksharding. He also praised Layer 2 teams for their progress and said Ethereum will enter a period of relative stability after the scalability roadmap is complete.

title: Just How Realistic Is an Ethereum Price Target of $10,000? - The Motley Fool
summary: The article discusses the potential price target of Ethereum (ETH) after the upcoming Shanghai upgrade. While some bulls predict a price target of $10,000 by 2025, the author remains skeptical. They argue that the upgrade may lead to a short-term price dump as investors unstake their Ethereum, potentially causing a price drop. Additionally, the author notes that Ethereum still has a long way to go in terms of achieving its promised upgrades, such as increasing transaction processing speed and lowering gas fees. They suggest a more realistic price target of $3,000, which represents a gain of over 50% from current prices.

title: Ether rises above $2,000 after the Shanghai upgrade, bringing year-to-date gain to more than 75% - CNBC
summary: Ether (ETH) price surged above $2,000 for the first time in eight months, driven by the recent Shanghai upgrade and investor optimism. The upgrade enabled staking withdrawals after a two-year lockup period, which has boosted liquidity and stoked institutional participation. The price of Ether rallied 10% to reach $2,130, its highest level since May 2022, and is on pace for a 13% weekly gain. Bitcoin (BTC) also saw a 3% increase to reclaim $30,000. However, some analysts have expressed skepticism about the sudden move higher in Ether, suggesting it may be driven by more than just the Shanghai upgrade.

title: Can Ethereum crack $2K? ETH price inches closer despite new unlocked supply - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum's price is edging closer to $2,000 despite the recent launch of the Shapella upgrade, which enables users to withdraw their ETH from the proof-of-stake smart contract. Despite the potential sell-off pressure, the market has absorbed the selling pressure so far, and the majority of staked ETH is still underwater. The price is slightly overbought, raising the likelihood of a short-term correction. If ETH breaks above $2,000, it could climb towards $3,000. However, a decisive breakout requires further analysis and investment research.

title: Ethereum Shanghai Update Goes Live as ETH Price Eyes $2,000 - CoinCodex
summary: The Shanghai update, a hard fork for the Ethereum network, has unlocked over $34 billion worth of ETH deposited on the Beacon Chain, allowing validators to withdraw their funds. This update has triggered concerns about the potential impact on ETH's price if a large portion of the deposited funds are sold. The Shanghai update has also integrated several other EIPs (Ethereum Improvement Proposals) to enhance the performance of the Ethereum network. The update launched on April 12, 2023, and has been named Shapella, combining Shanghai and Capella. The update has the potential to improve Ethereum's investment prospects and increase the number of users participating in securing the network by staking their coins. The algorithm predicts the price of ETH to increase to $2,500 in May and then drop to $1,050 in the next 3 months before a massive rally. The Shanghai update is seen as a significant step forward for Ethereum, reducing the power expenditure of the network and enabling validators to withdraw their ETH.

title: Ether Price Swings Upward After Ethereum Upgrade, but What About the Future? - CoinDesk
summary: Ether price surges after Ethereum upgrade, but future uncertainty remains. Upcoming un-staking process may flatten metric, but reduced risk and increased liquidity may boost asset value for those who want to stake.

title: Why Didn’t You Sell the News of Ethereum’s Shanghai Upgrade? - CoinDesk
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's Shanghai upgrade has created new assets called LSDs (Liquidity Supply Doublers) that allow users to double their holdings with a fee. These assets are critical for maintaining ETH liquidity and validation process, but actual ETH has generally traded above LSD prices due to increased risk and fees.

title: First Mover Asia: Ether Climbs Over $2.1K to Further Its Post-Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade Surge - CoinDesk
summary: Ether (ETH) prices surged past $2.1K following the Shanghai upgrade, with analysts suggesting that deposits into staking contracts indicate the asset is gaining favor. However, as unstaked ETH is liquidated, the trajectory may flatten in the coming weeks. Despite this, the upgrade has reduced risk and increased liquidity, leading to an uptick in asset value.

title: 'You don't have to really choose' between Bitcoin and Ethereum: Trader - Yahoo Finance
summary:
In a recent interview with Yahoo Finance, cryptocurrency trader Scott Melker shared his insights on the current market trends of Bitcoin and Ethereum. Melker emphasized that choosing between the two need not be a binary decision, as they are separate asset classes with distinct use cases.

Bitcoin, according to Melker, is a digital gold and a store of value, while Ethereum is more of a technological investment and an internet of value. He noted that the recent Shanghai upgrade for Ethereum has been a positive development for the protocol, but there has not been a huge demand for people to withdraw their staked Ether. Instead, there are more people waiting to deposit their money into the contract.

Melker believes that investors are becoming more bullish on Ethereum due to its use cases, but he stresses that both assets are separate and should be viewed as such. He encourages investors to love both or to choose based on their individual preferences, rather than feeling compelled to pick one over the other.

title: Ethereum Shapella upgrade: Community celebrates as update goes live on mainnet - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum's Shapella upgrade has gone live, marking a significant milestone for the network. The update unlocks new features such as the unstaking of Ether (ETH) and has sparked celebration within the community. Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin described the network as being in a "really good place" and noted that while significant work remains, the hardest and fastest parts of the transition are now behind us. The update has also led to increased interest in ETH staking opportunities from institutional investors, with Blockdaemon's Ethereum ecosystem lead predicting more involvement from larger investors. Meanwhile, Glassnode expects that only a small percentage of staked ETH will be sold following the update, with mechanisms in place to prevent a flood of ETH supply entering the markets at once.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Reaches $2,000: Key Reasons Behind the Rise - U.Today
summary: Ethereum (ETH) surges to $2,000, driven by the successful launch of Shapella and declining inflation expectations. Shapella enables validators to withdraw staked Ether, defying market expectations of increased selling pressure. Additionally, a drop in inflation as measured by the Producer Price Index (PPI) may have contributed to the price surge.

title: Ethereum: A $1000 Investment in ETH Turns $2.5 Million in April 2023 - Watcher Guru
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum investment of $1,000 in 2015 would be worth $2.5 million today in April 2023, with an increase of nearly 260,000%. The investment grew due to Ethereum's rapid increase in price, reaching $4,878 before dropping. Selling at the all-time high would have resulted in a valuation of $6.5 million. Current price of Ethereum is $1,918, up 2.8% in the last 24 hours.

title: Ethereum-based RIPPLEREUM Coin Announces Its Listing on the Uniswap Exchange on April 17 - Yahoo Finance
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

RIPPLEREUM Coin, an Ethereum-based cryptocurrency, will be listed on the Uniswap exchange on April 17. Uniswap is a decentralized exchange that provides liquidity through a pool of Ethereum and ERC-20 tokens. The RIPPLEREUM platform allows users to register various cards and use them for transactions. The ultimate goal is to build a smart card that can be used conveniently in real life. The RPRM Card Wallet will be expanded to enable services such as payment, exchange, remittance, and withdrawal. The platform will use blockchain technology for secure transactions and will be decentralized through policy voting and service-type cards for transportation and living convenience.

title: Shiba Inu (SHIB) Surpasses Ethereum (ETH) as Top Trending Asset on CoinMarketCap - U.Today
summary: Shiba Inu (SHIB) has surpassed Ethereum (ETH) as the top trending asset on CoinMarketCap, despite Ethereum's recent milestones. SHIB's price has spiked to $0.00001114, and its wallet count on Shibarium has skyrocketed by almost 10x to 3,122,259 within a day. This comes after Ethereum developers activated the Shapella upgrade, which allows stakers to withdraw ETH from the Beacon Chain deposit contract. However, Ethereum's price has also spiked to $2,000, driven by the Consumer Price Index release being below expectations.

title: $165,000,000 in Ethereum Unstaked in Just 24 Hours As Shapella Upgrade Goes Live - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Hundreds of millions of dollars worth of Ethereum (ETH) has been unstaked in the last 24 hours as the Shapella upgrade goes live. Data from Nansen reveals that over 89,000 ETH tokens worth $170 million have been withdrawn from staking protocols, with the average price of staked Ethereum higher than its current price. The largest entity to withdraw ETH was the Lido DAO, a liquid staking protocol. The Shapella update allows staked ETH to be withdrawn and the awards earned from the proof-of-stake protocol. Glassnode predicted that 170,000 ETH worth $300 million could be sold after the upgrade.

title: Ether price cracks $2K amid staking withdrawals enabled post-Shapella upgrade - Cointelegraph
summary: Ether (ETH) price surged to $2,000 after the successful Shapella upgrade, which enabled staked ETH withdrawals. Despite a potential new supply of ETH hitting the markets, the price maintained the level. Only 253 depositors have signed up to withdraw their staked ETH positions, according to Glassnode, and crypto exchanges have expressed support for ETH unstaking. Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin said the network is in a "really good place," but there is more work to be done.

title: Crypto community with 90% historical accuracy sets Ethereum price for April 30, 2023 - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Crypto community predicts Ethereum price to average $1,721 on April 30, with a historical accuracy of 90% over the last 6 months. Despite a momentary crash, Ethereum's overall trend suggests continued growth. The price is expected to reach $2,020 as resistance. Technical analysis is bullish, with oscillators and moving averages indicating a "strong buy." However, investing is speculative and carries risk.

title: Ether staking withdrawals: Crypto exchanges set calendar for unstaking - Cointelegraph
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum validators can now withdraw their staked Ether on the Beacon Chain after the successful Shapella upgrade on April 12. 126,955 ETH were withdrawn by validators at the time of writing, with 44% of active validators able to request partial or full withdrawals. The average price of staked ETH is $3,149, which may be a reason why validators are not withdrawing the whole amount. Major crypto exchanges have announced their support for ETH unstaking, with Coinbase, BitGo, and Kraken already processing withdrawal requests. The Shapella upgrade is expected to bring users to the ecosystem in the long run, despite potential price volatility caused by the high quantity of ETH unstaking. Binance and Bitfinex will also support ETH withdrawals starting from April 19 and April 13, respectively.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Pending For Withdrawal Rise Rapidly, Uptrend In Jeopardy? - NewsBTC
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's Shanghai and Capella upgrade has gone live without issues, allowing stakers and validators to withdraw their staked ETH for the first time in over two years. As of press time, about 700,000 ETH are waiting to be withdrawn, with the average price of all stakers at $1,973. While some fear an ETH dump, the current data suggests that there is no rush among investors to unstake ETH, and the initial withdrawals could be fully settled in as little as a week. The ETH price is currently bullish, trading at $1,921 and eyeing a break above $2,000.

title: Binance to Support Ether Staking Withdrawals From April 19 - CoinDesk
summary: Binance will begin supporting ether staking withdrawals on April 19, with a daily redemption quote for each user based on processing limitations on the Ethereum network. The quote is subject to change.

title: Canon to Launch Ethereum Photo NFT Marketplace Cadabra - Decrypt
summary: Canon to launch Ethereum-based NFT marketplace for photography, Cadabra, later this year. Marketplace will feature tokenized photographs across various categories, including wildlife, sports, and landscapes. Participating artists can offer physical prints of the images, and the platform will support both credit/debit card and cryptocurrency payments. This is Canon's second foray into the NFT space, following a Solana-based collection launched in 2022.

title: 3 signs Arbitrum price is poised for a new record high in Q2 - Cointelegraph
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Arbitrum (ARB) price is poised to reach new highs in Q2, driven by increased utility and market share gains. Arbitrum's sequencer revenue and profits have been growing, outperforming its top rival Optimism. Additionally, Arbitrum's TVL has been increasing, and its price has broken out of a descending triangle pattern, suggesting a potential upside target of $1.60. However, the ARB price may correct in the short term if it becomes overbought.

title: News Explorer — Binance Allows Users to Redeem Staked Ethereum From April 19 - Decrypt
summary: Binance will allow users to redeem staked Ethereum (ETH) starting from April 19, with a 1:1 exchange rate through their wrapped token BETH. Withdrawal requests cannot be canceled and may take several weeks to complete.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction: Explaining ETH Drab Performance After The Shapella Upgrade - Analytics Insight
summary: The Ethereum Shapella upgrade, which occurred on April 12, failed to generate significant price action for Ether, with the token's price increasing by only 0.12% hourly and 2.65% in the last 24 hours. The upgrade, which unlocked 12,859 Ether in the first hour and 81,249 ETH tokens in total, did not lead to a surge in demand for Ether as investors had expected. Instead, the Ethereum blockchain's high transaction fees and declining trading volume on decentralized exchanges have contributed to a range-bound movement in Ether's price. The article concludes that the Shapella upgrade remains a non-event for Ether's price, and that traders do not expect any significant price action in the near future unless there is an increase in staking unlock requests.

title: Kraken Leads Ether Unstaking Parade, Makes up 62% of Exit Queue - CoinDesk
summary: Kraken leads Ether unstaking parade, making up 62% of exit queue. Learn more about Consensus 2024 and register now at consensus.coindesk.com.

title: Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade is Now Live - Crypto Times
summary:
Sure! Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's Shanghai Upgrade is now live, allowing users to withdraw their staked ETH. As of April 12, 285 withdrawals totaling $10 million have been processed. The upgrade unlocked $34.5 billion in staked ETH and will take longer for stakers who deposited through intermediate pools or exchanges to withdraw. The next upgrade, EIP-4844, will improve rollup scalability. ETH saw a 2% gain in price after the upgrade, but no substantial change has been observed.

title: Ether (ETH) Token Gains as Analysts Cheer Shanghai Software Update Success - Bloomberg
summary: Ether (ETH) token price surged to highest since August as analysts' fears of rapid outflows following software upgrade prove overdone. Shanghai update enables staking rewards withdrawal, with 96% of volume from users withdrawing rewards, not entire stakes.

title: Crypto Price Today Live: Bitcoin holds above $30k; Solana, Ethereum rise up to 5% - The Economic Times
summary: Bitcoin and other major cryptocurrencies are trading higher, with Bitcoin holding above $30k. The market cap of the global cryptocurrency market is around $1.23 trillion, with Bitcoin's dominance at 47.25%. CPI data and the end of rate hike season may signal new liquidity in the markets, leading to a possible rally towards $32k. However, major market oscillators indicate a neutral sentiment, with the MACD indicating buy and the Stochastic RSI fast indicating sell. Top gainers include Solana, up 5%, and Polkadot, up 2.6%.

title: Crypto investors face delays in withdrawing funds after Ethereum upgrade - Yahoo Lifestyle UK
summary: Crypto investors are facing delays in withdrawing funds from the Ethereum blockchain after a recent software upgrade, known as "Shapella." The upgrade unlocked over $30 billion worth of ether, but investors cannot withdraw the funds they deposited via staking until Wednesday. As of Thursday, around $1.4 billion was stuck in a withdrawal queue, and the delays are due to limits in the blockchain's transaction processing capabilities. The Ethereum Foundation did not comment, and the delays are seen as an example of the network's potential shortcomings as it aims to become a widely-used financial infrastructure.

title: Ether Jumps Above $2K a Day After Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade - Yahoo Movies UK
summary: Ether (ETH) price surged above $2,000 after the successful upgrade of the Ethereum network to the Shapella hard fork, also known as the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade. The upgrade transitioned the Ethereum network from a proof-of-work (PoW) to a more energy-efficient proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism. The price increase was fueled by increased institutional investor participation and decreased supply due to validators joining an exit queue. The performance of ETH around the Shanghai fork will depend on market sentiment and the relationship between risk assets and ETH. Bitcoin (BTC) also saw a price increase, while other cryptocurrencies such as Lido DAO's LDO, Rocket Pool's RPL, and Stader's SD saw gains. The CoinDesk Market Index was up 3% for the day. Equities also edged up, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq rising by 1.2% and 1.9%, respectively. Gold inched towards its record high as investors continued to seek safe-haven assets.

title: Binance Announces Ether Staking Withdrawals Starting April 19th - Crypto Times
summary: Binance will start supporting $ETH 2.0 staking withdrawals on April 19th. Withdrawal requests may take up to 15 days to several weeks to be fully processed, and users cannot change their requests after submission. Binance will set a daily ETH redemption limit for each user due to Ethereum network processing constraints. The announcement comes after the Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade went live, unlocking around $34.5 billion in staked ETH.

summary:

* Solana (SOL) has been on a remarkable ascent, with a potential retest of its broken trendline presenting an entry opportunity for speculators.

Experts predict a staggering 35x increase in COLT’s price before summer, making it a must-have in the crypto space. The current presale offers COLT tokens at $0.014 each.

title: EOS Launches EVM, Announces $60M Strategic Partnership with DWF Labs - CryptoPotato
summary:

The EOS Network Foundation has also partnered with DWF Labs for a $60 million strategic investment to support the platform's growth. The EVM will enable Solidity developers to access EOS's scalable network infrastructure and resources, while the partnership with DWF Labs will channel resources towards facilitating the growth of the EOS ecosystem.

title: Bitcoin-friendly PPI data boosts bulls as Ether price fights for $2K - Cointelegraph
summary: Bitcoin held $30,000 support, but failed to convince investors it would stay at its 10-month high. Ether (ETH) passed $2,000 for the first time since August, but faces resistance at $30,500 on the Binance order book.

Investor sentiment remains strong.

title: Uniswap launches iOS mobile wallet in select countries - Cointelegraph
summary: Uniswap, a decentralized exchange, has launched a mobile wallet for iOS devices in select countries. The app allows users to swap tokens on Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, and Optimism networks and features built-in support for Uniswap. Users can back up their accounts and see detailed information about NFTs stored within the app. This launch comes after Uniswap complained to Apple that the app was being blocked from its stores. The app is available in most countries but a list of available countries was not provided by the time of publication.

title: The Emergence Of The Arbitrum Ecosystem Offers A Remedy To Ethereum's Issues, While Big Eyes Coin Captures The ... - Analytics Insight
summary: Arbitrum, a Layer-2 scaling solution, has emerged as a promising solution to Ethereum's issues, offering fast, scalable, and cost-effective transactions through its innovative optimistic roll-up technique. Founded by Off-Chain Labs, a team of former Princeton researchers, Arbitrum is fully compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine and enables developers to use their existing tools and smart contracts without changes. The platform is decentralized, secure, and offers versatility, with its native cryptocurrency, ARB, used for transaction fees and network governance. Additionally, Big Eyes Coin (BIG), an ERC-20 token, has gained attention for its unique approach and charitable goals, raising $32.5 million in its presale and offering a 250% return promotion.

title: The next Ethereum? 5 cryptocurrencies poised for massive growth in 2023 - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Five cryptocurrencies, Solana (SOL), Polkadot (DOT), Avalanche (AVAX), Polygon (MATIC), and Tezos (XTZ), are poised for massive growth in 2023, challenging Ethereum's (ETH) dominance. These digital assets have shown potential to replace Ethereum as the second most famous asset on the crypto market. Their lower gas fees, high transaction rates, and interoperability with Ethereum have made them attractive to investors. Although the future growth of these cryptocurrencies depends on multiple factors, their teams have demonstrated the capability to justify their status as Ethereum's main competitors, leading to strengthening prices.

title: Binance announces ETH redemptions for BETH holdings after Shapella Fork upgrade - Cryptopolitan
summary: Binance announced that users who staked Ether (ETH) through the exchange can begin redeeming coins with their BETH holdings at a 1:1 ratio starting April 19. The Shanghai upgrade has activated, allowing for the withdrawal of staked Ether, with approximately 285 withdrawals processed within 30 minutes, valued at $10 million. Binance warned that once submitted, withdrawal requests cannot be canceled and may take 15 days to several weeks to complete. The redeemed Ether will be returned to users' spot wallets, but BETH tokens locked in pending ETH withdrawal requests will not generate any ETH 2.0 staking rewards. The Shanghai upgrade has had little impact on ETH's price, which has risen by 5.34% over the past 4 hours to $1,995.
